content:
• Wednesday, September 9, 2015

  • S&P lowers troubled Brazil's rating to junk

    • Standard & Poor's has cut Brazil's investment-grade credit rating to junk for the first time since 2008, warning it could lower it again in coming months.
    • The firm pointed to political challenges putting a balanced budget at risk in lowering its rating to BB+ (the highest speculative rating).
    • Fitch and Moody's still have Brazil at investment grade -- for now. But if either one follows suit, as Brazil's situation rapidly degrades, it would trigger massive cash outflows from pension funds.
    • The move by S&P comes just six weeks after the agency lowered its outlook and warned of a ratings cut. Since that time, the Brazilian Real has slipped from 3.43/dollar to 3.7827/dollar.
    • After-hours action in ETFs: EWZ -7.2%, BRZU -20.4%.
    • Related ETFs: BRXX, BRAQ, BZQ, BRAF, UBR, DBBR, FBZ
    • Previously: Brazil's investment grade rating at risk (Jul. 29 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 PM | 17 Comments
  • PANW

    Palo Alto up 5.4% on results, guidance, billings; CyberArk up 2.1%

    • Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW) has risen to $174.00 after hours after beating FQ4 estimates (strongly on revenue), issuing solid FQ1 guidance, and reporting billings rose 69% Y/Y to $393.6M. Privileged account security software leader CyberArk (NASDAQ:CYBR) has risen to $49.28 in response.
    • Billings growth, fueled by the adoption of WildFire (malware-detection) and other subscription services, accelerated from FQ3's 56%. With billings well above revenue of $283.8M (up 59%), the deferred revenue balance rose 63% to $423.8M, and long-term deferred revenue 78% to $289.8M.
    • Financials: Product revenue (next-gen firewalls) rose 54% Y/Y to $154M, and services revenue 65% to $129.8M. Limiting EPS growth: GAAP operating expenses rose 57% to $244.1M, with sales/marketing spend totaling $162.4M. Palo Alto ended FQ4 with over $1.3B in cash/investments, and $487M in convertible debt.
    • FQ4 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: CNW +32.0%. SIGM +5.4%. PANW +4.8%. YRCW +4.5%. TOT +3.0%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: KKD -17.0%. MTH -2.0%. XPO -2.0%. QUNR -1.0%. UPL -0.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM | 2 Comments
  • KKD

    Krispy Kreme -16.5% after missing on FQ2, guiding full-year lower

    • Krispy Kreme (KKD) -16.5%Â AH after missing FQ2 earnings and revenue expectations and cutting full-year earnings guidance to reflect weaker than expected performance in its consumer packaged goods category.
    • KKD says it now expects FY 2016 EPS of $0.76-$0.80, compared with its previous estimate of $0.80-$0.85 and below analyst consensus of $0.85.
    • During FQ2, KKD says system-wide domestic same store sales rose 5.5%, including a 2.3% gain at company stores, but international franchise same store sales fell 2.7% excluding currency impacts.
    • Overall, system-wide store count rose 18% Y/Y to 1,045 company-owned and franchised shops.
    • Also, the KKD board increased current share repurchase authorization during the quarter to $155M from $105M.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM | 4 Comments
  • USAC

    USA Compression to launch 4M-unit offering

    • USA Compression Partners (NYSE:USAC) -5.1%Â AH after announcing a public offering of 4M common units, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 600K units.
    • USAC says it plans to use the proceeds to pay down debt outstanding under its revolving credit facility and for general partnership purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM | 3 Comments
  • AMID

    American Midstream to launch 7.5M-unit offering

    • American Midstream Partners (NYSE:AMID) -9.8%Â AH after announcing a public offering of 7.5M common units, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 1.125M units.
    • AMID says it plans to use the proceeds to fund part of the purchase of a stake in a company that will indirectly own a portion of the Delta House floating production system and related pipeline infrastructure.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • MBLY

    Mobileye closes down 8.1% after Citron sets $25 short-term target

    • Mobileye (NYSE:MBLY) is Citron Research's latest target: The short-seller predicts shares will fall to $25 in the near-term, and go below $10 in the long-term. (Citron's report - .pdf)
    • Citron declares Mobileye's valuation (66x trailing sales, 18.6x estimated 2017 sales) "unfathomable," and (citing a bearish column from SA author Suhail Capital) predicts competition from Bosch, Continental, Delphi, Denso, and Autoliv will take a toll - Mobileye has argued its algorithms and driving data act as a long-term differentiator for its ADAS solutions.
    • Also: Citron calls Mobileye's R&D spend ($56M over the last 18 months) "miniscule," and notes various insiders/major shareholders have sold $1.6B worth of shares since the IPO at an average price of $33.14. It suggests recent hype about autonomous/self-driving cars (compared to prior hype about 3D printing) has propelled shares higher.
    • Shares tumbled to $48.36 today. The Nasdaq fell 1.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM | 12 Comments
  • AMBA

    Ambarella closes down 6% as GoPro tumbles following conference talk

    • Last week, GoPro sold off hard in response to Ambarella's (NASDAQ:AMBA) FQ3 guidance. Today, Ambarella fell sharply after GoPro (down 10.2%) CFO Jack Lazar presented at a Citi conference (webcast).
    • Ambarella is now down 24% since last week's FQ2 report, and has fallen to itsÂ  lowest levels since April. Shares are still up 35% YTD.
    • Prior Ambarella coverage
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 15 Comments
  • CNW

    Bloomberg: XPO Logistics near deal to buy Con-way for $3B

    • Con-way (NYSE:CNW)Â +32.3%Â AH after Bloomberg reports XPO Logistics (NYSEMKT:XPO) is closing in on a $3B deal to buy the rival trucker.
    • XPO and CNW reportedly have reached a preliminary agreement on price and structure for an all-cash takeover, and a deal could be announced as soon as late today.
    • A deal would extend the string of transactions that have helped XPO grow into a major player in the global logistics market; since 2011, XPO has completed at least 14 mergers and increased its revenue to a projected $6.7B this year from $177M.
    • Update: XPO agrees to acquire CNW for $47.60/share, a 34.7% premium over today's closing price.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 10 Comments
  • BOX

    Box up 3.2% after FQ2 beat, guidance hike; billings rise 45%

    • With an FQ2 beat on the books, BOX is now guiding for FY16 (ends Jan. '16) revenue of $295M-$297M, above prior guidance of $286M-$290M and a $289.6M consensus. Op. margin (non-GAAP) guidance has been slightly improved to -47% to -49% from -49% to -51%.
    • FQ3 revenue guidance is at $76M-$77M (above a $74.3M consensus), and op. margin guidance at -49% to -50%.
    • Billings/customers: Billings rose 45% Y/Y in FQ2 to $79.6M, topping revenue of $74.5M (+43%); FQ1 billings growth was 58%. The paid customer rose to 50K+ from. 47K+ at the end of FQ1, and includes over 52% of the Fortune 500 and 28% of the Global 2000; new/expanded deployments included IBM (previous), Airbnb, Uber, Alcoa, and Lionsgate. Registered users rose by 2M Q/Q to 39M+.
    • Financials: GAAP operating expenses rose 30% Y/Y to $102.6M. Sales/marketing spend (closely-watched) totaled $58.5M, or 73% of billings. R&D spend totaled $26.5M, and G&A $17.7M. Gross margin fell to 71.8% from 79% a year ago. Box ended FQ2 with $242.2M in cash, $28.2M in restricted cash, and $40M in debt.
    • Shares have risen to $14.70 after hours.
    • FQ2 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • PANW

    Palo Alto beats estimates, guides strong; shares rise

    • Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW): FQ4 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $283.9M (+59.3% Y/Y) beats by $27.64M.
    • Expects FQ1 revenue of $280M-$284M and EPS of $0.31-$0.32 vs. a consensus of $269.6M and $0.31.
    • Shares +5.8% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 2 Comments
  • SLH

    Bloomberg: Solera close to ~$53/share deal to sell company

    • P-E firms Thoma Bravo and Vista Equity are reportedly among the final bidders for Solera (SLH -2.1%) as it nears a sale. Sources add "a strategic company" may have also bid, and that a buyer could be decided as soon as next week.
    • Bloomberg originally reported on Aug. 19 the auto insurance software firm was considering a sale. A $53/share deal would imply a $3.6B valuation. Shares are currently trading at $48.40; the 52-week high is $60.72.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • NTES

    NetEase up 1.7% after Mizuho upgrades to Buy

    • NetEase (NASDAQ:NTES) is countering a down market today, up 1.7% after an upgrade from Mizuho to Buy.
    • The analysts bumped the rating a notch from Neutral, and set a price target of $135. Shares closed yesterday at $112.37 and are currently at $114.29, implying more than 18% upside.
    • That target is slightly below analysts' consensus price target, just over $145. Throughout 2015, covering analysts have lifted Neutral ratings to Buy for the Chinese game maker.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • FOX

    FCC chief: Fox will take part in airwaves auction

    • Twenty-First Century Fox (FOX -1.6%, FOXA -1.3%) will take part in the broadcast incentive auction for wireless airwaves next year, according to the FCC chairman.
    • Tom Wheeler told attendees at the CTIA convention that Fox CEO James Murdoch told him the broadcaster would show up for the auction, which will reallocate and repack broadcast spectrum to be sold to wireless providers for expanded coverage.
    • The auction's expected to bring $25B, with stations that give up airwaves getting a cut of the proceeds.
    • Fox has 28 stations in 17 markets, including top markets New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, Dallas, San Francisco, Washington, D.C., and Houston.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • COSWF

    Canadian Oil Sands says it has no plan to sell future production

    • Canadian Oil Sands (OTCQX:COSWF -3.5%) says it had reviewed selling a small portion of its future production from the Syncrude oil sands project but decided against it for now.
    • The company says a sale would have involved a small percentage of revenues it generates from crude production in a exchange for a one-time payment; it evaluated the option in light of what other companies have done, citing recent sales by Cenovus Energy and Encana of freehold royalty properties to raise cash, but believes it does not need additional funding.
    • WSJ reported yesterday that COSWF had discussed a potential sale of future production with shareholder Highlands Capital.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • WGBS

    WaferGen Bio up 51% on prospects of single-cell analysis system

    • Thinly traded nano cap WaferGen Bio-systems (WGBS +51.3%) jumps on a whopping 25x surge in volume in response to its announcement that it will be presenting throughput and performance data from its single-cell analysis system at the Single Cell Genomics Conference on September 16 in Utrecht, The Netherlands. Data generated by the company's early access partners will also be presented.
    • The results will demonstrate that thousands of individual cells can be isolated and analyzed from heterogeneous cell populations which, when partitioning the chip into multiple sections, enables the screening of cells for applications such as therapeutic dose determination and gene insertion/deletion efficacy.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM
  • ZQK

    Quiksilver rides the wave to bankruptcy

    • Quiksilver (ZQK) officially files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy to end a long period of speculation on the future of the surfwear company.
    • Financing from Bank of America and affiliates of Oaktree Capital Management will keep Quiksilver's operations afloat.
    • The bankruptcy does not impact Quiksilver's business in Asia and Europe.
    • Previously: Quiksilver looks for a buyer (Sept. 2)
    • Previously: Bloomberg: Quiksilver to plan bankruptcy filing as soon as tonight (Sept. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM | 3 Comments
  • GPRO

    GoPro down 5.2% amid CFO's Citi conference presentation

    • Jack Lazar began talking at Citi's 2015 Global Tech Conference (webcast) at 11:45AM ET. GoPro (NASDAQ:GPRO) was lower before Lazar's presentation, and has fallen below $36 since.
    • Lazar reportedly stated Q4 revenue should account for a mid-30s to low-40s % of full-year sales, which at the midpoint suggests above-consensus revenue. Ambarella's FQ3 guidance has heightened concerns about GoPro's 2H15 outlook, and led many to assume there won't be additional major camera launches this year.
    • Shares have made new 52-week lows, and are now down 44% YTD.
    • Yesterday: GoPro unveils $15K VR camera array; Baird cuts estimates
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 50 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: VTAE +91%. WGBS +60%. AKBA +56%. CHEK +32%. TRR +23%. VVUS +20%. CLVS +19%. TITN +19%. NVET +19%. NX +17%.
    • Losers: TTPH -79%. FLXN -29%. WG -21%. BKS -15%. NSPH -13%. BLIN -13%. AFMD -13%. THRX -12%. MPO -12%. OTC:AXPW -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • CONN

    Conn's names new CEO and reveals plan to securitize debt

    • Conn's (CONN -0.9%) names Norman Miller to be the company's new CEO.
    • Miller, a former President at both Sears Automotive and DFC Global, will succeed Theodore Wright who will stay on the board as executive chairman.
    • The retailer also decided to securitize $1.4B in consumer debt.
    • Shares of Conn's have retreated from earlier gains on volume already 4X normal activity.
    • Previously: Conn's EPS and revenue in-line (Sep. 09 2015)
    • Previously: More on Conn's Q2 (Sep. 09 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • STM

    STMicro down 4.4% day after Citi presentation

    • STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM) is selling off in the wake of CFO Carlo Ferro's Tuesday afternoon presentation (webcast) at a Citi conference. Shares rose 4.6% yesterday, aided by a big chip stock rally that followed Microchip's calendar Q3 guidance revision.
    • In other news, STMicro has launched new SoCs for low-cost cable, satellite, and IPTV set-tops. The chips run on ARM's CPU and GPU cores, and support HEVC video codecs. STMicro has said it's exploring options for Digital Product Group, as it contends with weak image sensor demand and set-top share losses to Broadcom.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • CSFFF

    Capstone Mining to halt Chile project, cut capex, reduce operating costs

    • Capstone Mining (OTCPK:CSFFF +3.9%) says it will halt work on its Santo Domingo copper-iron development project in Chile, scale back capital spending and reduce mine operating costs to preserve cash amid weak copper prices.
    • Capstone says it has cut planned spending at its operating mines by 13% to ~$119M, and expects to cut mine site operating costs by $20M through H2.
    • Full-year production guidance remains unchanged at 90K metric tons of copper, while cash costs have been reduced $0.05 to $1.95-$2.05/lb. to reflect spending cuts and operating efficiencies at two of its producing copper mines.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • VIVHY

    Vivendi raises stake in Telecom Italia to 15.5%

    • Vivendi (OTCPK:VIVHY +0.4%) is continuing its ownership push in Telecom Italia (TI +2%), raising its stake yet again in the carrier, to 15.5%.
    • The holding is worth €3.3B (about $3.7B) today.
    • "Rome was not built in a day," said CEO Arnaud De Puyfontaine of Vivendi's steps toward building a southern Europe-focused media group. "When you got a big plan you have different steps and it’s not by the snap of your fingers that you do that."
    • Vivendi's move comes even as TI is considering a savings-stock conversion that would have the effect of diluting the French conglomerate's stake.
    • The French company has gathered €9B in cash after disposing of other telecom assets over the past few years.
    • Previously: Telecom Italia mulling $6B savings-stock conversion (Sep. 04 2015)
    • Previously: BollorÃ© ousts Canal Plus chief, takes hands-on role (Sep. 03 2015)
    • Previously: JPMorgan reverses course, bumps Vivendi two notches to Buy (Sep. 01 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • CNET

    ChinaNet Online -2.1% after getting Nasdaq listing notice

    • ChinaNet Online (CNET -2.1%) has received a listing notice from Nasdaq based on 30 days under a minimum bid price of $1.
    • The company has 180 calendar days (until March 7) to regain compliance by reaching a minimum bid of $1/share for 10 consecutive business days during the time frame.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • GLNCY

    Metals move higher following plans for output cuts

    • Industrial metals continue their recent climb, with aluminum, zinc and lead trying to play catch-up with copper, which has gained 5% this week as more miners mothball operations at loss-making mines.
    • Glencore's (OTCPK:GLNCY, OTCPK:GLCNF) Monday announcement that it will cut 400K metric tons of copper production over the next 18 months at two mines in the Democratic Republic of Congo and Zambia comes in the wake of closures or cutbacks at mines controlled by Freeport McMoRan (FCX +4.3%) and others; shortly after Glencore’s decision, the Chinese operator of the Baluba mine in Zambia said it was suspending operations and cutting jobs.
    • The closures follow a high level of production outages across the copper industry this year because of bad weather and labor disputes, with the combined effect helping to tighten the difference between supply and demand.
    • ETFs: JJC, DBB, JJN, JJU-OLD, CPER, JJT-OLD, BOM, RJZ, BOS, FOIL, JJM, LD, BDD, NINI, CUPM, LEDD
     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 9 Comments
  • UAL

    United Continental flying steady after CEO exit

    • A management shakeup at United Continental (UAL +0.2%) isn't causing any sense of panic with investors or analysts as most are taking an optimistic view the reset could improve the company's financial performance.
    • Investment firms Cowen, Raymond James, and Credit Suisse have all issued positive comments on the long-term impact of the development.
    • Shares of UAL areÂ +0.31%Â today to trail most airline peers by a bit.
    • Previously: United Airlines CEO Smisek resigns; CSX exec named successor (Sept. 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 5 Comments
  • CRNT

    Ceragon up 8.8% after announcing North American deals

    • Ceragon (NASDAQ:CRNT) has landed orders from three major North American mobile carriers/existing clients for its IP-20 RF backhaul systems. The systems will be used to expand/modernize the carriers' 4G networks.
    • Deals with Asia-Pac carriers (combined value of more than $43M) were announced in July. Following a rough 2014, Ceragon is up 48% in 2015.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • VLO

    Valero CEO Gorder eyes acquisition opportunities

    • Valero Energy (VLO +1.5%) may soon return to its roots as a buyer of refineries, CEO Joe Gorder tells the Barclays Energy Conference in New York in the company's broadest commitment to acquiring new refineries since 2005 when founder Bill Greehey stepped down.
    • As late as this April, Gorder said VLO would grow its existing assets and was not looking to buy plants, but the CEO now says the company already had refineries and logistics assets in its sights.
    • Gorder does not say where VLO was shopping for possible purchases, but the CEO expects a higher growth rate in the logistics sector, where VLO, like its competitors, operates an MLP focused on crude oil and refined products pipelines and terminals.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • ECA

    Encana's August average production up 15% over Q2

    • Encana (ECA +3.9%) opens to solid gains after reporting that its assets in the Permian, Eagle Ford, Duvernay and Montney basins produced an average of 257K boe/day in August, up 15% from 223K boe/day in Q2.
    • ECA says itÂ has brought 72 new wells on production in the four strategic assets so far during Q3, and that it is on track to meet Q4 expectations.
    • Production in the Permian Basin averaged 45K boe/day in August, up from 35.8K in Q2, while Eagle Ford production averaged 57.1K boe/day in August, up from 45.8K in Q2.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • DDAY

    Viggle up 3.9%, entering daily fantasy sports with DraftDay buy

    • Viggle (VGGL) is up 3.9% as it and UK firm Sportech have teamed up to buy daily fantasy operator DraftDay from MGT Capital Investments (MGT +13.3%), grabbing a foothold in a growing market.
    • The two will form DraftDay Gaming Group to capitalize on the new asset. Viggle will own 44% and Sportech 35%, with MGT and other shareholders holding the remainder. Viggle CEO Robert F.X. Sillerman will be chairman of the board of the new entity.
    • Sportech, the sports gaming and betting firm, will handle day-to-day operations. As for advertising, Viggle's app will be integrated into the DraftDay games
    • DraftDay has paid out more than $30M in prizes to date. Users can draft a team within a salary cap and pursue daily rewards in a market currently ruled by DraftKings and FanDuel.
    • Sportech is down 2% in London trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • SNOW

    Strong guidance boosts Intrawest Resorts Holdings

    • Intrawest Resorts Holdings (SNOW +16%) jumps after the company hits the mark with FQ4 results and issues pleasing guidance.
    • The mountain resort operator sees total segment revenue in the range of $571M-$596M for FY16 - consisting of $435M-$450M for the mountain segment, $85M to $90M for the adventure segment, and $51M to $56M for the real estate segment.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • TWER

    Towerstream up 5.3% on billboard service deal with Syscom

    • Towerstream (NASDAQ:TWER) is up 5.3% after pairing up with System Telecom on an infrastructure project that will see the two exploiting billboard locations for networking service.
    • The two will co-market microwave backhaul, small cell and Wi-Fi service after Syscom formed a partnership with out-of-home advertiser Kinetic (WPPGY) to use tens of thousands of locations, including digital billboards.
    • The billboards' real estate makes for ideal small cell locations, the companies say, and billboard advertisers seek data and geo-targeting via Wi-Fi.
    • In its last quarterly report, Towerstream said it had executed a contract with a "leading carrier" to co-locate small cells on shared infrastructure.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • VVUS

    Icahn Enterprises subsidiary bids for Vivus convertible debt; shares up 29%

    • Vivus (VVUS +29.2%) jumps on more than double normal volume in response to the news that Icahn Enterprises subsidiary IEH Biopharma LLC has made a cash tender offer for all of its outstanding 4.50% Convertible Senior Notes due 2020 at a price of $680/$1,000 principal amount plus accrued interest. The offer will expire at 5:00 pm ET on October 7 unless extended or earlier terminated.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 1 Comment
  • BNED

    Barnes & Noble Education higher after earnings

    • Barnes & Noble Education (BNED +1%) trades higher after posting its first post-spinoff earnings report.
    • Comparable-store sales were up 1.8% during a quarter that isn't typically busy for a college business.
    • The company expects capital expenditures of $55M for the full fiscal year as it makes some strategic investments to pursue growth opportunities.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • PBPB

    Potbelly higher after firing off new buyback plan

    • Potbelly (PBPB +6.2%) rips higher after the company announces it will buy back up to $35M worth of shares under a new repurchase allowance.
    • The buyback firepower reps about 10% of the restaurant stock's market cap.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM | 3 Comments
  • OISHF

    Oil Search to block Woodside exclusivity demand, may open path for Exxon

    • Oil Search (OTCPK:OISHF) will reject a demand by suitor Woodside Petroleum (OTCPK:WOPEF, OTCPK:WOPEY) to hold exclusive talks as part of its A$11.6B takeover offer, potentially paving the way for Exxon Mobil (XOM +1.5%) to emerge as a rival bidder, Sydney Morning Herald reports.
    • XOM is the operator and largest shareholder in Oil Search'sÂ Papua New GuineaÂ liquefied natural gas project, and is said to have held an informal meeting with Oil Search CEO PeterÂ Botten​Â in the country yesterday.
    • Macquarie analysts believe that XOM, as operator of PNG LNG, is unlikely to make any due diligence process easy for Woodside given sensitivities around early work it is performing on the P'nyang and Elk-Antelope gas fields; Bernstein's Neil Beveridge expects upwardÂ revisions to Woodside's offer for Oil Search and counter bids possibly from XOM, "who would be the most likely competitor."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM | 6 Comments
  • HOV

    Hovnanian slumps after disappointing quarter

    • FQ3 (ended July 31) net loss of $7.7M or $0.05 per share vs. income of $17.1M and $0.11 one year earlier.
    • Homebuilding gross margin of 17.8% down from 21.3% a year ago.
    • Net contracts including consolidated JVs of 1,658 up 16.4% Y/Y. Dollar value of $694.6M up 27.9%.
    • Backlog of 3,275 homes up 12.7% Y/Y. Dollar value of $1.37B up 23.5%.
    • Deliveries of 1,475 homes down 4.8% Y/Y.
    • Cancellation rate of 20% down 200 basis points from last year.
    • For August the number of net contracts rose 15.4% from August a year ago to 531; dollar value of $217.3M up 15.3%.
    • FQ4 revenue guidance of $745M, with pretax profit of $22M. Full-year revenue of $2.7B-$3.1B, with pretax profit of $40M-$100M.
    • CEO Ara Hovnanian is disappointed with FQ3, but says results are within what the company guided for.
    • Conference call at 11 ET.
    • Previously: Hovnanian misses by $0.04, misses on revenue (Sept. 9)
    • HOVÂ -5.9%
     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 2 Comments
  • HOV

    Hovnanian misses by $0.04, misses on revenue

    • Hovnanian (NYSE:HOV): FQ3 EPS of -$0.05 misses by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $540.6M (-1.9% Y/Y) misses by $71.35M.
    • Shares +1.8% PM.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • MA

    MasterCard on watch as execs present at investor meeting

    • Management with MasterCard (NYSE:MA) is presenting today at an investor meeting.
    • In early comments, the company tips that it sees high single-digit revenue in 2015 including 2 percentage points of growth from acquisitions. Operating expenses are also seen rising at a high single-digit rate. The impact of F/X fluctuations is estimated at six to eight points of growth.
    • MasterCard presentation slides (.pdf)
    • MA -1.85% premarket to $91.18.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers as of 9:10 am

    • Gainers: AKBA +72%. VTAE +35%. VGGL +15%. ACRX +15%. TROV +11%. CONN +10%. PLAY +10%. PLX +7%. SNP +5%.
    • Losers: TTPH -78%. FLXN -26%. AQXP -11%. MNKD -7%. NXTD -7%. CAPN -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM | 6 Comments
  • KLIC

    Kulicke & Soffa issues FQ4 warning; shares -8.4%

    • Kulicke & Soffa (NASDAQ:KLIC) now expects FQ4 (calendar Q3) revenue of $100M-$110M, well below prior guidance of $135M-$145M and a $140M consensus.
    • The chip bonder equipment maker blames high semi inventory levels and low capacity utilization rates. "The Company believes this softer industry environment is largely driven by reduced demand within consumer and communication segments such as PCs, tablets and smartphones. This lower end market demand is anticipated to limit near-term semiconductor unit growth and decrease the industry's immediate need for incremental production equipment."
    • Kulicke still expects to recognize a $20M tax benefit in FQ4, and to continue making buybacks. It has "initiated measures to address the current market situation, including execution of near-term operational improvements."
    • Shares have fallen to $9.79 premarket. Kulicke's warning follows a string of capex budget cuts from Intel, as well as one from TSMC.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM

  • SBGL

    Sibanye Gold to buy Amplats' Rustenberg assets for at least $331M

    • Sibanye Gold (NYSE:SBGL) agrees to acquire the Rustenberg platinum mining and concentrating operations in South Africa from Anglo American Platinum (OTCPK:AGPPY, OTCPK:AGPPF) for at least 4.5B rand ($331M).
    • The deal involves an upfront payment of 1.5B rand, with a minimum deferred payment of 3B rand, equal to 35% of cash flow generated by the operations, making 20B rand the maximum potential value of the deal.
    • The sale allows Amplats, which had considered separately listing the mines, to focus on shallower, lower cost and more mechanized operations as platinum prices fall to multi-year lows.
    • For SBGL, the deal will boost future cash flow to pay dividends if the miner can lower costs and raise production as has happened at four aging gold mines.
    • SBGL +3.9% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:52 AM
  • ACRX

    AcelRx Pharma's ARX-04 successful in late-stage study; shares up 28% premarket

    • AcelRx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACRX) is upÂ 28%Â premarket on modest volume in response to its announcement that its investigational ARX-04 (sufentanil sublingual tablet, 30 mcg) met its primary and secondary endpoints in a 163-subject Phase 3 clinical trial called SAP301. The double-blind, placebo-controlled study assessed ARX-04 for the short-term management of moderate-to-severe acute post-operative pain in patients after abdominal surgery.
    • Patients receiving ARX-04, administered sublingually via a disposable, pre-filled, single-dose applicator, experienced significantly greater pain relief versus placebo over the first 12 hours of treatment.
    • The primary endpoint was the difference in SPID-12 score compared to placebo over 12 hours. SPID-12 scores for the ARX-04 cohort were +25.8 versus +13.1 for control. The difference was highly statistically significant (p<0.001). The difference in pain intensity from baseline was superior for ARX-04 at 15 minutes, the earliest time point measured (p=0.002). Secondary endpoints were also met.
    • The data will be presented at the upcoming American Society of Anesthesiologists Annual Meeting in late October in San Diego, CA.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:34 AM | 2 Comments
